com.studiomediatech.queryresponse

Class QueryBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.studiomediatech.queryresponse.QueryBuilder

  • public class QueryBuilder
extends Object
    The main entry type for query building, provides static factory methods to create a chaining query builder.

    • Method Detail

      • queryFor

        public <T> ChainingQueryBuilder<T> queryFor(String term,
                                            Class<T> type)
        Creates a new chaining query-builder for the given term, and the expected type that result elements will be mapped to. The query term string, can use any pattern or structure, as defined by the system design. It expresses some need or interest in information. The given type, provide the target data type, that is used to coerce any response elements that are consumed.

        The type, of the eventually resulting Collection is also inferred by the type argument.

        For example:

                   Collection<String> names = QueryBuilder.queryFor("names/rock-legends", String.class)...
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of the result elements, and the type argument.
        Parameters:
        term - to query for. A String of up to 255 characters.
        type - of response elements. Any Java type or class to map JSON responses to. Also infers the type of the returned results Collection - if the built query succeeds.
        Returns:
        a new ChainingQueryBuilder instance, never null
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the query term argument is invalid.
